ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Tailoring
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh yeah, I know that. It s ALWAYS a good idea to con any mobs you can see. And if you are able to sow yourself, I suggest you do that. Bc at least with sow you
ygData.messageBody:
Oh yeah, I know that. It's ALWAYS a good idea to con any mobs you can see.
And if you are able to sow yourself, I suggest you do that. Bc at least with
sow you can outrun the giants. You may not be able to outrun some of the
other mobs though. But camo is good to avoid goblins and a few others. I'm
not saying you should feel completely safe when in camo. But some giants
can't see through camo. I know bc I took a ranger through that zone with
camo and all of the giants I encountered conned indifferent. Now, that was
just my experience. I know that there are mobs that do see thru invis. One
must always be careful.
Btw, do the guards at Felwithe see through invis?
luv,
-Su

> Su,
>
> You offer good advice, but I have to add a warning about the Frontier
> Mountains zone. You mentioned having Camouflage memmed, which, while a
good
> idea while travelling in any dangerous zone, can lull you into a false
sense
> of security in FM (Dreadlands too). I say that because the Mountain Giants
> are not fooled by Camo, or Invis -- they see right through it, and would
not
> be a good chance meeting for a level 29 druid travelling alone. I think
some
> of the Goblin Casters and perhaps the Burynai Cenobites can also see
through
> Camo/Invis.
>
> Froondor, Wood Elf Druid of 41 seasons
> Tarew Marr
>
